title: Case Studies: Machine Learning Approaches for Software Development Effort Estimation

title: Navigating the Complexity of Generative AI Adoption in Software Engineering
abstract: This article explores the adoption of Generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) tools within domain software engineering, focusing on influencing factors at individual, technological, and social levels. We applied a convergent mixed-methods approach to offer comprehensive understanding AI dynamics. initially conducted questionnaire survey with 100 engineers, drawing upon Technology Acceptance Model, Diffusion Innovation Theory, Social Cognitive Theory as guiding theoretical frameworks. Employing Gioia methodology, we derived model in engineering: Human-AI Collaboration Adaptation Framework. was then validated using Partial Least Squares–Structural Equation Modeling based data from 183 engineers. Findings indicate that this early stage integration, compatibility existing development workflows predominantly drives their adoption, challenging conventional technology acceptance theories. The impact perceived usefulness, factors, personal innovativeness seems less pronounced than expected. study provides crucial insights for future tool design offers framework developing effective organizational implementation strategies.

title: Integrating Generative AI for Advancing Agile Software Development and Mitigating Project Management Challenges
abstract: Agile software development emphasizes iterative progress, adaptability, and stakeholder collaboration. It champions flexible planning, continuous improvement, rapid delivery, aiming to respond swiftly change deliver value efficiently. Integrating Generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) into processes presents a promising avenue for overcoming project management challenges enhancing the efficiency effectiveness of endeavors. This paper explores potential benefits leveraging AI in methodologies, streamline workflows, foster innovation, mitigate common challenges. By harnessing capabilities tasks such as code generation, automated testing, predictive analytics, teams can augment their productivity, accelerate delivery cycles, improve quality products. Additionally, offers opportunities collaboration, facilitating decision-making, addressing uncertainties inherent management. Through an in-depth analysis integration within frameworks, this provides insights how organizations harness transformative advance practices navigate complexities modern projects more effectively.

title: Generative AI for Software Practitioners
abstract: Generative artificial intelligence (AI) tools, such as Bard, ChatGPT, and CoPilot, have rapidly gained widespread usage. They also the potential to boost software engineering productivity. In this article, we elaborate technologies usage of generative AI in industry. We address questions, as: How does improve productivity? connect development, what are risks? Which sorts benefits? Practitioner guidance case studies shared from our industry context. I look forward hearing you about column that matter most for your work.—Christof Ebert

title: Machine/Deep Learning for Software Engineering: A Systematic Literature Review
abstract: Since 2009, the deep learning revolution, which was triggered by introduction of ImageNet, has stimulated synergy between Software Engineering (SE) and Machine Learning (ML)/Deep (DL). Meanwhile, critical reviews have emerged that suggest ML/DL should be used cautiously. To improve applicability generalizability ML/DL-related SE studies, we conducted a 12-year Systematic Literature Review (SLR) on 1,428 papers published 2009 2020. Our trend analysis demonstrated impacts brought to SE. We examined complexity applying solutions problems how such led issues concerning reproducibility replicability studies in Specifically, investigated ML DL differ data preprocessing, model training, evaluation when applied tasks, what details need provided ensure study can reproduced or replicated. By categorizing rationales behind selection techniques into five themes, analyzed performance, robustness, interpretability, complexity, simplicity affected choices models.

title: On the Reproducibility and Replicability of Deep Learning in Software Engineering
abstract: Context: Deep learning (DL) techniques have gained significant popularity among software engineering (SE) researchers in recent years. This is because they can often solve many SE challenges without enormous manual feature effort and complex domain knowledge. Objective: Although DL studies reported substantial advantages over other state-of-the-art models on effectiveness, ignore two factors: (1) reproducibility —whether the experimental results be obtained by using authors’ artifacts (i.e., source code datasets) with same setup; (2) replicability result their re-implemented a different setup. We observed that commonly overlook these factors declare them as minor threats or leave for future work. mainly due to high model complexity manually set parameters time-consuming optimization process, unlike classical supervised machine (ML) methods (e.g., random forest). study aims investigate urgency importance of tasks. title: Towards Accountability for Machine Learning Datasets: Practices from Software Engineering and Infrastructure
abstract: Datasets that power machine learning are often used, shared, and reused with little visibility into the processes of deliberation led to their creation. As artificial intelligence systems increasingly used in high-stakes tasks, system development deployment practices must be adapted address very real consequences how model data is constructed practice. This includes greater transparency about data, accountability for decisions made when developing it. In this paper, we introduce a rigorous framework dataset supports decision-making accountability. title: A Survey on Deep Learning for Software Engineering
abstract: In 2006, Geoffrey Hinton proposed the concept of training “Deep Neural Networks (DNNs)” and an improved model method to break bottleneck neural network development. More recently, introduction AlphaGo in 2016 demonstrated powerful learning ability deep its enormous potential. Deep has been increasingly used develop state-of-the-art software engineering (SE) research tools due boost performance for various SE tasks. There are many factors, e.g., selection, internal structure differences, optimization techniques, that may have impact on DNNs applied SE. Few works date focus summarizing, classifying, analyzing application techniques To fill this gap, we performed a survey analyze relevant studies published since 2006.
